title: British National Vegetation Classification
text:
The British National Vegetation Classification or NVC is a system of classifying <a href="nature">natural</a> <a href="habitat%20%28ecology%29">habitat</a> types in <a href="Great%20Britain">Great Britain</a> according to the <a href="vegetation">vegetation</a> they contain.
A large scientific meeting of <a href="ecologist">ecologist</a>s, <a href="botanist">botanist</a>s, and other related professionals in the <a href="United%20Kingdom">United Kingdom</a> resulted in the publication of a compendium of five books: "<a href="British%20Plant%20Communities">British Plant Communities</a>", edited by <a href="John%20S.%20Rodwell">John S. Rodwell</a>, which detail the incidence of plant species in twelve major habitat types in the British <a href="natural%20environment">natural environment</a>. They are the first systematic and comprehensive account of the <a href="vegetation">vegetation</a> types of the country. They cover all natural, semi-natural and major artificial habitats in Great Britain (not <a href="Northern%20Ireland">Northern Ireland</a>) and represent fifteen years of research by leading plant <a href="ecology">ecologists</a>.
From the data collated from the books, commercial <a href="software">software</a> products have been developed to help to classify vegetation identified into one of the many habitat types found in Great Britain – these include "MATCH", "TABLEFIT" and "MAVIS".
Terminology used in connection with the British National Vegetation Classification.
The following is a list of terms used in connection with the British National Vegetation Classification, together with their meanings:
Constant species.
For a list of the constant species, and the NVC communities in which they are present, see <a href="List%20of%20constant%20species%20in%20the%20British%20National%20Vegetation%20Classification">List of constant species in the British National Vegetation Classification</a>.
Rare species.
For a list of these rare species, and the NVC communities in which they are present, see <a href="List%20of%20rare%20species%20in%20the%20British%20National%20Vegetation%20Classification">List of rare species in the British National Vegetation Classification</a>.
